properties.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued February 5 at 11:01AM PST until February 7 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
...Moderate to heavy rain and snowmelt to cause rapid rises
on creeks and streams through Friday morning...

The National Weather Service in Pendleton has issued a

* Flood Watch for a portion of south central Washington,
including the following area, East Slopes of the Washington
Cascades.

* From 4 PM PST this afternoon through Friday morning

* Moderate to heavy rainfall is expected tonight through early
Friday. The rain combined with snowmelt will cause significant
rises on rivers and streams with some flooding possible on
smaller streams and creeks draining out of the Cascades.

* At this time, the area expected to be most affected is the
headwaters of the Yakima river northwest of Cle Elum.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING
